TITLE: What borrowers need to know as the Public Service Loan Forgiveness program goes on a partial processing pause
SUMMARY: The popular Public Service Loan Forgiveness program will be partially paused from May 1 through July, the U.S. Department of Education recently said.

TITLE: This 401(k) match change could have 'unintended consequences' at tax time, experts say
SUMMARY: If you've opted into your employer's Roth 401(k) after-tax matching contribution, it could trigger a tax surprise, experts say. Here's what to know.

TITLE: Most of Warren Buffett’s wealth was accumulated after age 65. Here’s what that can teach individual investors
SUMMARY: One of Warren Buffett's biggest investing advantages is time. Here’s what individual investors can learn from his approach.

TITLE: IRS aims to more than double its audit rate for wealthiest taxpayers in strategic plan update
SUMMARY: The IRS has released an update on its strategic operating plan, which includes more audits on the wealthiest taxpayers, large corporations and partnerships.

TITLE: 'If Americans want lower interest rates, they're going to have to do it themselves,' analyst says. Here's how
SUMMARY: Without a Fed rate cut on the horizon, consumers are going to have to take matters into their own hands if they want a break from sky-high credit card APRs.

TITLE: The Education Department will transfer some student loan borrowers to a different servicer. Here's what you need to know
SUMMARY: The U.S. Department of Education recently said that it will soon transfer some student loan borrowers to different servicers. Here's what you need to know.

TITLE: Why your financial advisor may not give you the best Social Security claiming advice
SUMMARY: When to claim Social Security is one of the biggest decisions retirees face. But financial advisors' guidance may be biased, recent research finds.

TITLE: The Federal Reserve holds interest rates steady, offers no relief from high borrowing costs — what that means for your money
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve pushed out rate-cut expectations — here's what that means for your credit card, mortgage rate, auto loan and savings account.

TITLE: How to make your home hurricane resistant, as scientists predict an 'extremely active' storm season
SUMMARY: Upgrades could help consumers protect their home, typically one of their most valuable assets, from hurricanes and other natural disasters.

TITLE: Biden administration forgives $6.1 billion in student debt for 317,000 former Art Institute students
SUMMARY: The Biden administration announced that it would forgive more than $6.1 billion in student debt for 317,000 former students of the Art Institutes.

TITLE: 'It's a good time to lock in,' expert says. What to know to get the best rates on your cash now
SUMMARY: Stubborn inflation may lead the Federal Reserve to keep interest rates where they are for longer. That's good news for cash savers, experts say.

TITLE: An important student loan forgiveness deadline is hours away — and it takes under 15 minutes to apply
SUMMARY: Some student loan borrowers have until April 30 to take advantage of an opportunity to get their debt forgiven sooner than they would have otherwise.

TITLE: Treasury Department announces new Series I bond rate of 4.28% for the next six months
SUMMARY: The U.S. Department of the Treasury announced the new rate for Series I bonds through October 2024.

TITLE: Op-ed: How to navigate premium increases for long-term care insurance
SUMMARY: A significant long-term care insurance premium increase can force people to choose between financial security and compromising their access to quality care.

TITLE: How one nonprofit is turning to AI to help boost women's financial literacy
SUMMARY: New artificial intelligence tools may make financial information more accessible. Experts say that may be a game-changer when it comes to financial literacy.

TITLE: As home sellers, buyers wait on a Fed cut, here's how mortgage rates have impacted the spring housing market
SUMMARY: While some buyers have come to terms with 7% interest rates, the rate volatility is the factor with the biggest impact, an economist says.

TITLE: 29% of households have jobs but struggle to cover basic needs: They are 'one emergency from poverty,' one expert says
SUMMARY: Nearly 40 million families, or 29% of the population, are defined as ALICE, which stands for Asset Limited, Income Constrained, Employed.

TITLE: Op-ed: My bank, their bank or our bank
SUMMARY: One of the most important conversations newlyweds need to have is figuring out how and who will pay the bills. That goal can be reached in so many ways.

TITLE: Advice about 401(k) rollovers is poised for a big change. Here's why
SUMMARY: Rollovers from 401(k) plans to individual retirement accounts are a key focus of a new Labor Department rule that aims to raise the bar for retirement advice.

TITLE: 'Nobody's getting wealthy on Social Security,' lawmaker says. The November election may influence the program's future
SUMMARY: Social Security's trust funds are projected to run out in the next decade. When lawmakers address that dilemma, they will also define the program's future role.

TITLE: New home sales inch higher despite 7% mortgage rates: 'There's more opportunity,' economist says
SUMMARY: Buyers are highly considering newly built homes amid a shortage of available homes in the U.S. Here's what this means and where prices are standing.

TITLE: IRS free tax filing pilot processed more than 140,000 returns, saved consumers $5.6 million in prep fees
SUMMARY: This season, the IRS Direct File pilot helped more than 140,000 million taxpayers file taxes for free and saved $5.6 million in tax prep fees.

TITLE: Miami is 'ground zero' for climate risk. People are moving to the area and building there anyway
SUMMARY: Miami is undergoing a boom despite a high vulnerability to sea level rise, floods and more intense storms. Residents may face financial hardship.

TITLE: Climate change could cost Americans born in 2024 nearly $500,000 in their lifetime
SUMMARY: In a new series by the CNBC personal finance team, we're delving into how climate change will impact your money.

TITLE: Why Americans worry changes to the U.S. retirement system could upend their plans
SUMMARY: When it comes to retirement, Americans worry about uncertainties they cannot control, like a higher cost of living or changes to the retirement system.

TITLE: This job perk is like a 'cash bonus' — but you need a long-term strategy, experts say
SUMMARY: Restricted stock units are a common type of equity compensation. Here's what to know about this popular employee benefit, according to experts.

TITLE: A key deadline for student loan forgiveness consolidation is just days away. Here's what to know
SUMMARY: Borrowers hoping for student loan forgiveness have just a few more days to act before an April 30 deadline.

TITLE: Taylor Swift’s new song resonates with working women — ‘I cry a lot but I am so productive, it's an art’
SUMMARY: A lyric from Taylor Swift's "I Can Do It With a Broken Heart," on her new "Tortured Poets Department" album, is resonating with many working women on TikTok.

TITLE: BlackRock wants to make it easier to get paycheck-like income from your retirement savings
SUMMARY: One of Americans' biggest retirement fears is running out of money. BlackRock hopes a new way to take paycheck-like withdrawals from investments may help.

TITLE: As more borrowers qualify for student loan forgiveness, incoming college freshmen are set to rack up $37,000 in new debt, report finds
SUMMARY: Most families take out student loans to cover the rising cost of college. A new report found that incoming freshmen may have $37,000 in debt by graduation.
